alert.note: Alert for Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 24 at 11:57AM AKST until December 24 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOWFALL DIMINISHING FOR MANY AREAS FOR CHRISTMAS EVE... Snow totals across the panhandle have ranged from as low as 2 inches to up to 13 inches, but most have been in the 4 to 8 inch range. The first band of precipitation has moved out of the area to the north and the second is now forecast to stall and weaken over the central inner channels this evening. Several winter storm warnings have been cancelled as a result. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches. * WHERE...Petersburg, Kake, Port Alexander, and surrounding areas. * WHEN...Until 9 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility near downtown Juneau. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow rates are starting to increase again as the next snow band starts to move in. Around 7 inches of snow has already falling in the area. Expect another 2 to 5 inches of snow through the afternoon and evening hours with low visibility at times.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
